item.value: Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
Atari releases Pong, the first commercial video game on November 29, 1972.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press in 1436 . Gutenberg is also accredited with printing the world's first book known as the Gutenberg Bible.
If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall. The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
The South Pole is the least sunny placeon earth with only 182 days a year off sunshine
Steve Wozniak designed the first Apple computer in 1976. It was known as the Apple I.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
There are 206 bones in the adult human body and are 300 in children. As children age some bones fuse together.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
